title: CSS Comments
subject: CSS
learning_objectives: Learn how to write comments in CSS
Learn how to comment out code for debugging
theory:
Comments are used to explain the code, and may help when you edit the source code at a later date. Comments are ignored by browsers.

A CSS comment is placed inside the `<style>` element, and starts with `/*` and ends with `*/`.

examples.output: The text 'Header Styling' is not displayed.
examples.explanation: The browser ignores the text between /* and */ completely.

common_mistakes.correction: Do not use <!-- --> in CSS files. It won't work.
common_mistakes.example:
WRONG: <!-- This is a comment -->
CORRECT: /* This is a comment */

common_mistakes.correction: CSS comments cannot be nested inside other CSS comments.

interview_questions.question: Can you use // for comments in CSS?
interview_questions.answer: No, standard CSS does not support double slashes // for comments (though some preprocessors like SCSS do). You must use /* */.

practice_problems.problem: Comment out the following CSS rule so it doesn't run: `body { background: red; }`

real_world_use_cases.description: Developers use comments to create 'Table of Contents' in large CSS files.

exam_notes: Comments start with /* and end with */.
summary: Comments are vital for code readability and team collaboration. Use them liberally to document your work.
